comments.body: It looks ok in this case but as a general rule prefer to put the //ignore at the end of the offending line rather than before it

May be a bug. Doesn't seem to actually work on multi-line expressions when it's like:
```
aFutureReturningFunction(
  a,
  b
); // ignore: unawaited_futures
```

cc @leafpetersen but maybe try:

```
aFutureReturningFunction( // ignore: unawaited_futures
  a,
  b
);
```

This hope seems optimistic...

cc @yjbanov did you mean to not wait for this future?
Looks like a bug. I think we should `await`. I usually leave a comment if I'm dropping a `Future` on the floor intentionally.
feel free to just inline the future-returning calls in the Future.wait call, fwiw.

sent a follow up #10786
Do wish this syntax was more succinct/readable though
Nice!
It looks like all callers are passing `whitelistBranchName=true`, so let's nuke the parameter
runner.dart does not.
Here too (It looks like all callers are passing `whitelistBranchName=true`, so let's nuke the parameter)
it'd be great if we could say what the current version was, what the new version was, and what channel the user was on.

I had a go at this, but it turned into more work than I expected - we now carry around and cache both a remote commit date and also the version. I've pushed it to a branch for now so you can have a quick scan in case it's going in the wrong direction or you'd just rather it another PR for review.

https://github.com/DanTup/flutter/commit/d474a5499e6ae8a6878f92f203df6e11ab61a1d3

The tests are all passing, but there's a lot here and it's slightly complicated to manually test (without rigging code or resetting the git pointer to an old revision and just running with the changes in working dir) so it's a little risky (which I guess goes for this PR too!).
doing it in another PR (or not at all for now, if it's not tractable) is fine.
is `kPauseToLetUserReadTheMessage` intentionally mutable? if so, we should rename it to not start with `k`.
I suspect it was originally immutable, though seems like it's modified in a test setup now (presumably to speed the test up). I'll remove the `k` for now, but lmk if you'd prefer another fix.
Let's make kVersionAgeConsideredUpToDate be 5 weeks instead of 4, since we release betas every 4 weeks. No need to push people to update too aggressively.
This feels like it will fail for people who are working on a git branch.
Unless we also want to stop all flutter engineers from working it, we'll need to permit user branches somehow
Should this be in the future so we don't prompt the new version available warning?
Nope I have this backwards, having it in the past will prevent that warning. Ignore!

`_latestGitCommitDate()` is used to get both the local and remote date of the latest commit. Luckily, the logic to decide whether to show the update message is already handling `VersionCheckError`. When coming from that logic, `lenient` is false, and the exception will still be thrown. I'll add some comments about this.
Investigated this a bit more and added some code to more defensively bail from the update check on a version check failure.
Should we prompt them to re-download the SDK?
Also, does this print with `--machine`?  We should avoid printing anything that isn't parsable like https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/29209
I think it should probably print unconditionally. An automatic process that parses the version output should probably fail if the info is just a placeholder.
nit. can you use the `channel` getter from here https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/version.dart#L111
I can't because instantiating that type calls this method
doh! lgtm then
No longer `-dev`
I had to support the `-dev` tag or else when I land this (before there are the new tags) the tool will be in a bad state (and pre-submit was failing because it couldn't parse the current version)

It was either support the `-dev` tag, or change the `git describe --match` glob, and I figured if I support the `-dev` tag here, I can safely remove it after the next dev release with the new tag format.
If possible, can you split out the -dev parsing code to more clearly delineate what logic can be removed after the next dev?
This entire method can be removed in the next dev.
No longer `-dev`
does this not need a cast from `String?` to `String`?

> does this not need a cast from `String?` to `String`?

No, there's no logical branch that sets it to a nullable value.  See more explanation in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/79911#discussion_r609054707
thanks, nice catch
why do we need to assign this to a temp variable?
ahh, so right now the analyzer is able to infer that channel gets assigned a `String`? SGTM
Can you remove `Version.checkAgeConsideredUpToDate`, `Version.versionAgeConsideredUpToDate` etc?  Having two copies to keep in sync seems unnecessary.
I thought I did, my bad
